name: Afghanistan
interestingFact: since the use of the first flag in 1709, Afghanistan has had 26 different flags?

name: Albania
interestingFact: Albania is the world’s largest hydroelectricity producer? 100% of the country’s energy is hydroelectric.

name: Algeria
interestingFact: Algeria is the largest African nation, spread across more than 2 million square kilometres?

name: Andorra
interestingFact: the country of Andorra can fit into the City of London more than three times?

name: Angola
interestingFact: Angola has a shortage of men, so common practice for a man is to have several wives?

name: Antigua
interestingFact: Antigua has no rivers and no lakes?

name: Argentina
interestingFact: Argentina government banned parents from naming their children after Messi, worrying about confusion later down the line if the name was to become too fashionable?

name: Australia
interestingFact: Indian Pacific train has the longest straight section of train track in the world?

name: Austria
interestingFact: Vienna has the oldest zoo in the world which was founded in 1752.

name: Azerbaijan
interestingFact: Azerbaijan has the museum with the world’s largest collection of miniature books with more than 5,500 teeny tiny books on display.

name: Bahamas
interestingFact: the Bahamas is home to its own sea monster? It can change color, and it’s been described as “half-shark and half-octopus!

name: Bahrain
interestingFact: Bahrain was historically famed for its pearl fisheries, which were considered to be among the best in the world.

name: Bangladesh
interestingFact: in Bangladesh you commit a crime if you leave the house without wearing underwear?

name: Barbados
interestingFact: Barbados is the birthplace of rum, Mount Gay Distilleries has been churning out rum since 1703.

name: Belarus
interestingFact: Belarusians love a good superstition. A particularly popular one is that you should never whistle in your house or you’ll blow all your money away.

name: Belgium
interestingFact: until the 1970s, in Belgium light beer was served during school lunch?

name: Belize
interestingFact: Many Belizeans avoid swimming in the ocean or rivers on Good Friday; it is viewed as bad luck. Local Mothers can often be heard telling their kids they “will turn fish!” if they swim on this day!

name: Bermuda
interestingFact: Bermuda is the Shipwreck Capital of the World, to date, over 300 wrecks have been found dating back to the 1600s.

name: Botswana
interestingFact: Botswana is one of the World’s biggest diamond producers?

name: Brazil
interestingFact: Brazil has the biggest carnival in the world. The Rio Carnival in Rio de Janeiro sees 2 million people.

name: Brunei
interestingFact: Brunei has one of the highest car-ownership rates in the world? The Sultan of Brunei alone owns five thousand cars.

name: Bulgaria
interestingFact: Bulgarians express approval by shaking their heads rather than nodding. Weird, huh.

name: Burkina Faso
interestingFact: the people love the horses in Burkina Faso. The White Stallion is the country’s national symbol.

name: Burundi
interestingFact: the traditional beer is drunk from one central pot by almost a dozen people using long straws?

name: Bhutan
interestingFact: Paro is known as the most dangerous airport to land on in the whole world. Only 8 trained pilots are allowed to do this.

name: Cambodia
interestingFact: spiders, scorpions, snakes, insects like maggots, cockroaches, and crickets are all cooked up and eaten in Cambodia?

name: Canada
interestingFact: Canada has the longest coastline and the longest international border in the world?

name: Cape Verde
interestingFact: in Cape Verde it is rude to eat in public without sharing your food?

name: Cayman Islands
interestingFact: in Cayman Islands is a dive site for every day of the year

name: Chad
interestingFact: Chad has over 200 ethnic groups, and 100 languages are spoken?

name: Chile
interestingFact: the Atacama Desert is one of the driest places in the world, there are areas that go hundreds of years without receiving any rain at all.

name: China
interestingFact: the mortar used to bind the Great Wall’s stones was made with sticky rice?

name: Colombia
interestingFact: Colombia has a naturally occurring Rainbow River whose aquatic plants and algae have created a red, blue, orange, yellow, and green flowing stream?

name: Comoros
interestingFact: Comoros has one of the smallest populations in the world and is one of the most densely populated countries in the world?

name: Congo
interestingFact: the Congo River is the deepest river (220 m) in the world?

name: Costa Rica
interestingFact: Costa Rica does not have a standing army?

name: Croatia
interestingFact: Croatia is home to the world’s smallest town? According to sources it has a population of between 17 and 23!

name: Cuba
interestingFact: Cuba is home to the smallest bird in the world? The bee hummingbird grows to 6 cm in length!

name: Curacao
interestingFact: there’s not one person that has visit Curacao and not seen an iguana? They’re everywhere and are protected.

name: Cyprus
interestingFact: Cyprus is home to the oldest manufactured wine in the world? Is a sweet dessert wine and you can trace its origins as far back as 2000BC.

name: Czechia
interestingFact: the Czechia has the highest castle-density in the world? Get your fix of medieval charm with more than 2,000 around the country!

name: Denmark
interestingFact: the Danish language has no word for please?

name: Dominica
interestingFact: Sulfur springs and black-sand beaches surround the capital city of Roseau?

name: Dominican
interestingFact: it is  illegal to kiss a woman in front of a police officer?

name: Timor
interestingFact: Dugongs are considered sacred animals to locals, and are not hunted?

name: Ecuador
interestingFact: Ecuador’s highest mountain, Mount Chimborazo, at its peak is the furthest point from the Earth’s center?

name: Egypt
interestingFact: the 365-day calendar that is divided into 12 months was invented in Egypt?

name: El Salvador
interestingFact: it is considered polite to leave a small amount of food on your plate when you’ve finished eating?

name: England
interestingFact: in England, it’s illegal to get drunk in a pub?

name: Eritrea
interestingFact: one of the oldest human skeletons was discovered in Eritrea? A one-million-year-old hominid skull was found near the village of Buia.

name: Estonia
interestingFact: in Estonia wife-carrying is a sport?

name: Eswatini
interestingFact: Eswatini has two capital cities? Mbabane is the administrative capital while Lobamba is the national capital.

name: Ethiopia
interestingFact: Ethiopians measure the hours of a day to a different schedule? The clock starts when the day does. Thus, sunrise is 1 o’clock and sunset 12.

name: Finland
interestingFact: in Finland, they have ‘National Sleepy Head Day’, where the last person in a family to wake up is thrown into a lake by the rest of the family.

name: France
interestingFact: the French army still use carrier pigeons?

name: Gabon
interestingFact: the Gabonese people use masks to praise the ancestors and to mark important life events by signifying transformation?

name: Gambia
interestingFact: during elections, Gambians vote using marbles? They simply drop their marble into the hole of candidate they choose.

name: Georgia
interestingFact: the world’s deepest cave is found in Georgia? Veryovkina Cave  reaches a depth of 2,212 metres!

name: Germany
interestingFact: there is no speed limit on the highways in Germany?

name: Ghana
interestingFact: that coffins in Ghana have unique shapes such as lions, fish, crabs, shoes and airplanes?

name: Guam
interestingFact: there is no sand on the island of Guam? The beaches are covered in coral instead of sand, and paved roads in Guam are made by mixing coral and cement.

name: Guatemala
interestingFact: Guatemalans invented the first ever chocolate bar?

name: Guinea
interestingFact: in the Nimba Mountains of Guinea  chimpanzees were first observed using tools to chop up and reduce food into smaller bite-sized portions?

name: Guyana
interestingFact: Guyana is home to the world’s largest single drop waterfall? The Kaieteur Falls has a total length of 251 meters!

name: Haiti
interestingFact: Voodou still is a regular practice in Haiti?

name: Honduras
interestingFact: local buses are called Chicken buses? They’re brightly painted and look like a party on wheels. You’re unlikely to see chickens on these buses.

name: Hong Kong
interestingFact: the mystical art of feng shui remains common practice in Hong Kong? The rooftop of Central’s HSBC Hong Kong building includes two rods to deflect bad energy.

name: Hungary
interestingFact: Budapest has the highest number of thermal springs in the world?

name: India
interestingFact: Rajasthan has a Temple of Rats!

name: Indonesia
interestingFact: Indonesia is the largest archipelago in the world?  Officially, there are over 17,500 islands that comprise Indonesia.

name: Iran
interestingFact: the weekend in Iran is Thursday and Friday? Thursday is like Saturday, banks and shops are open but some offices are closed, while Friday is like Sunday.

name: Poland
interestingFact: Poland is home to the world’s biggest castle? The Castle of the Teutonic Order in Malbork is the largest castle in the world by land area.
